item.source: Free Google Netbook - With Chrome OS

item.title: Free Google Netbook - With Chrome OS
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

I forgot to mention that moparscape beat you lol:

[quote=“xryz, post:1, topic:372610”]Well yesterday i noticed a update from google on facebook about this pilot program. So I applied to test out a chrome notebook. I didnt expect to get one but 10 minutes b4 my next class started i got a knock on my door.

it was ups with a box. i was like i didnt order anything. then i opened it and was like omg i actually got one,i was in shock for like the next 3 hours. So far i like it even though it is for testing so i can give feedback to google; I like it. I plan to use it when ever i have internet related tasks to do which can be alot of things.

so far i haven’t had much trouble with it but i still have much more to test it on. I doesn’t come with java installed but I have read you can install it. So i am trying. I am going to test RS on this. so google “chrome notebook” if you want to know more. Apply if you feel like you want to test and give feedback to help google with their product. post some feedback here as well.

Edit: here is a pic if this isnt good enough i can take another one that will include me. ill just have someone take the pic of me holding it. i tried taking it myself but it looked weird. i plan on making a review on youtube about it later on when i get more use to it.

b123562b4fef8e10b3bfe8e97ea82996f70b2a90289a3fb4e710770e0ed539975g.jpg800×600

this shows this thread if you zoom in you can see that. also that paper to the right of the picture comes with the notebook. you can also read some of that if you zoom in. i read that they had 60,000 units so idk if that is truly the amount they are giving out or not. i applied within a hour of google posting about this program. my class including my teacher has applied for one also but that was 24+ hours after googles announcement. idk if my speedy application played a role in why i got one, but i applied with accurate information. I truly thought i wouldnt get one.

Note: i never got an email from google saying they were sending me one. it just arrived at my apartment.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.source: Free Google Netbook - With Chrome OS

item.title: Free Google Netbook - With Chrome OS
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

I think if you’re going to spend money on a laptop/netbook/ipad, you might as well shell out just the little more to get a small laptop.

Sure, netbooks are smaller, but they’re just as inconvenient to carry as a laptop. They don’t fit in your pocket, and you’d want a small case for it. They weigh less, but that shouldn’t be a deciding factor anyway.

Also, running OpenOffice and Chrome only in Windows usually gives me ~2 hours battery life on my 15" laptop. And that’s the most I’ll get from that.

However, both of those programs when I’m on Linux will get me ~3.5 hours battery life.

The way I see it, you’re sacrificing the option to have a better work system for hours more on battery life. I can’t imagine a time where I’d need more than 3 hours on a laptop to browse the web or write things, without being near a power source. That’s just my usage.

Read full topic
item.source: Free Google Netbook - With Chrome OS
